thread.title: Will emerging markets leave the U.S. in the dust on healthcare?
thread.title_full: Will emerging markets leave the U.S. in the dust on healthcare?

title: Will emerging markets leave the U.S. in the dust on healthcare?
text:
30 Will emerging markets leave the U.S. in the dust on healthcare? 
Fortune: Universal healthcare is having a moment. In The New York Times last Thursday, The Rockefeller Foundation placed a full-page ad declaring its support for 267 economists from 44 countries who have argued that universal health coverage policies are morally urgent and economically efficient. Among the most famous signatories of the declaration was former Treasury Secretary Larry Summers, who in an op-ed in the Financial Times wrote that providing universal health coverage could exceed the costs of doing so by a factor of 10.
